Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.

questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone

ALLEGATION:
The agency has not submitted records to MDHHS (Michigan Department of Health
and Human Services) for permanent retention one year following the final order of
adoption as required. There are six records that have not been submitted.
INVESTIGATION:
On 5/23/2022 I reviewed the complaint, and contact was made with the complainant
via email by my Peer Consultant. I made initial contact with the agency about the
complaint via email on 5/24/2022.
On 5/25/2022, Adoption Departmental Manager (ADM) X provided information about
the complaint to me, and a Peer Consultant, via email. ADM X reported her
department had been in contact with agencies about their closed adoption records.
The department had inquired with the agencies as to the status of the closed
adoption files requested. Her department found that these files either had not been
submitted to the local office at all or were submitted outside the required timeframe
of 12 to 13 months following finalization. ADM X listed six finalized adoption files for
Ennis Center for Children-Port Huron that may not have been submitted.
ADM X provided clarity on how the files are to be closed and sent to the County
Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) office, and the DHS-788 form to
be attached on the closed file boxes. Additionally, ADM X provided information with
respect to if an agency still has old closed adoption records outside the ones on the
list provided related to the complaint; and what that agency should do with those
records. Whether those closed records should come to ADM X’s office or the
County DHHS Office. ADM X reported, when R400.12713 was updated in 2015,
agencies were instructed to send their backlogged adoption records directly to
Central Office. She reported, it has been seven years and at this point agencies
should be caught up, and on schedule to send closed records to the local offices
between 12-13 months following finalization. If an agency still has old closed
adoption records, her office will work with the agency, accept those old records, so
as to not have the local county office bombarded with old records. She advised it
would be very helpful if the agency would include in any corrective action plan the
agency’s plan to ensure that Lansing/the department gets those old records.
On 5/26/2022 via telephone and 6/15/2022 via onsite visit, I interviewed Licensee
Designee 1. He also reported information via email on 5/24/2022. Licensee
Designee 1 reported no one ever asked for the six records until recently in April
2022. He said the agency received a letter from Lansing asking for the closed
adoption records for Child A, Child B, Child C, Child D, Child E, and Child F. The
3

letter indicated a deadline of 4/27/2022 for when those closed adoption records were
to be submitted; and Ennis-Purton Huron met that deadline. The agency dropped
Child A, Child B’s, Child C’s, Child D’s, Child E’s and Child F’s closed records off to
Port Huron County DHHS on 4/26/2022. They discovered later, Child E’s and Child
F’s files went to Port Huron County in error. These two records should have gone to
Macomb County DHHS. The agency retrieved those records from Port Huron DHHS
and submitted them to Macomb DHHS on 5/24/2022. Licensee Designee 1 provided
documentation showing the respective submissions.
Licensee Designee 1 expressed concern that a complaint was made related to the
agency when they met the deadline. Especially since he knows other agencies who
did not submit timely, and those agency did not get a complaint. He also expressed
concerns, which his adoption administrator reported to him related to difficulties, in
the past, trying to submit closed records to the county DHHS offices. He reported
that varies offices were wanting the record closed a specific way, or the county office
was refusing to take records because that county office, at the time, did not know
what to do with the boxes of records being submitted. He reported, Ennis-Port
Huron currently has 52-54 finalized adoption records that go back to 2019, which
need to be sorted/effectively closed out and submitted to DHHS. The agency’s plan
is to have these records dropped off to the county offices by 6/23/2022.
Licensee Designee 1 reported the agency’s plan to stay rule compliant going forward
is to utilize its billing sheet for the child’s finalization as a tickler. As soon as the
billing sheet shows they billed one year back, they will drop off the closed adoption
record within two weeks of that date. The agency will document closed record
submissions to the DHHS county office via a receipt acknowledge signoff form. The
agency’s clerical staff will track these finalization and record the submission via a
spreadsheet. The actual adoption record submission receipt acknowledgement
forms will be maintained in a binder, so as to compare to the billing sheet.
During my on-site visit on 6/15/2022, I observed the agency’s secure closed file
adoption storage room; and saw records were in the process of being put together
and boxed.
Reviewed:
 A copy of an adoption file records list from Adoption Departmental Manager
X; the agency closed record submission receipt acknowledgement forms, all
as referenced earlier in this report.
 A copy of a closed record submission receipt acknowledgement form showing

Huron DHHS. This document was received by email from Licensee Designee
1, on 6/21/2022, who indicated the remaining six records will be dropped off

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12713 Adoption placement record.
(5) The Michigan department of human services must
permanently retain all adoption records for children
adopted from Michigan's child welfare system. The
adoption agency must forward any adoption records for
children adopted from the Michigan child welfare system to
the department one year after finalization of the adoption.
The adoption agency may not retain the original copies or
any other copies of the adoption records.
ANALYSIS: With respect to the six adoption records named in the complaint;
the agency submitted those records to DHHS by the 4/27/2022
response date listed in the letter to the agency. Those adoptions
were finalized in October and November 2020; and their
submissions to the department was after the timeframe stated in
the rule.
Additionally, the agency admitted it had 52-54 outstanding
finalized adoption records going back to 2019 which it had not
submitted to DHHS. These records are beyond the 12–13-
month timeframe the department allows after adoption
finalization for record submission. The agency is in violation of
rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan continuation of the agency’s
current licensing status is recommended.
